revision.text:
{{Wireless embedded system |brand=Aruba Networks |model=AP-344 |revision=(APIN0344) |series=AC3000 |fcc_date=10/10/2017 |manuf_country=China |is_manuf=No |manuf=Wistron NeWeb |type=access point |fcc_id=Q9DAPIN0344345 |ic_id=4675A-APIN0344345 |pwr_v=48 |pwr_amp=0.75 |pwr_barrel_outer=3.5 |pwr_barrel_inner=1.35 |pwr_barrel_len=9.5 |pwr_poe=at |cpu1_brand=Broadcom |cpu1_model=BCM58525 |cpu1_cspeed=1.2 GHz |cpu1_cores=2 |fla1=256 |fla1_brand=Winbond |fla1_model= |ram1=512 |ram1_brand=Winbond |ram1_model=W632GG6KB-12 |ram1_num=2 |expansion_if_types=USB 2.0, |expansion_usb_num=1 |wi1_chip1_brand=Broadcom |wi1_chip1_model=BCM43465 |wi1_802dot11_protocols=an+ac |wi1_ant_conn=U.FL, RP-SMA, |wi1_txchains=4 |wi1_rxchains=4 |wi1_sstreams=4 |wi2_chip1_brand=Broadcom |wi2_chip1_model=BCM43465 |wi2_802dot11_protocols=abgn+ac |wi2_ant_conn=U.FL, RP-SMA, |wi2_txchains=4 |wi2_rxchains=4 |wi2_sstreams=4 |eth_cpu=true |eth_chip2_brand=Broadcom |eth_chip2_model=BCM54514A0;BCM54514AOKFEBG; |lan_speed=2.5G |lan_ports=2 |addl_chips=Bluetooth LE MCU;Texas Instruments;CC2540T;CC2540T, F256, TI 731, ASCQ G4;1; |flags=Bluetooth LE, 256QAM, 1024QAM, VHT160, MU-MIMO, DFS, TPM, LACP, Link Aggregation, |802dot11_protocols=abgn+ac }}
:• 1x '''2166''' Mbps - 4SS 5GHz [https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/IEEE_802.11ac#Data_rates_and_speed 802.11ac] (80MHz chan., 1024QAM), :• 1x '''800''' Mbps - 4SS 2.4GHz [https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/IEEE_802.11n-2009#Data_rates 802.11n] (40MHz chan., 256QAM) = '''''3000 Mbps'' class''' :or :• 2x '''2166''' Mbps - 4SS 5GHz [https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/IEEE_802.11ac#Data_rates_and_speed 802.11ac] (80MHz chan., 1024QAM) = '''''4300 Mbps'' class'''
{{TagLine|802.11a/b/g/n/ac Wireless Access Point AP-344}} :{{ProductPage|http://www.arubanetworks.com/en-au/products/networking/access-points/340-series/}} ''High performance 802.11ac Wave 2 with dual 5GHz radios'' :''and multi-gig Ethernet support'' *[[Aruba Networks AP-344 (APIN0344)]]: External antenna models *[[Aruba Networks AP-345 (APIN0345)]]: Internal antenna models {{See also|Aruba Networks|Wistron NeWeb}} One of the two radios may be configured as 2.4GHz or 5GHz :allowing the device to broadcast two 5GHz networks. 5GHz 802.11ac mode is either 4SS/VHT80 or 2SS/VHT160. {{See also|Mist Systems AP41|Netgear WAC740}} The MicroUSB jack is a proprietary serial console interface.
